Be stuck having to chaperone his not so little sister, Mercedes.
See if auntie Juanita could possibly help him.
145.content:
"Soon you will be man, Enrique."

Enrique Vega rolled his eyes. "Yes, padre."

His father was repeating this talk more and more frequently as Enrique's thirteenth birthday approached. In the Vega family one's ascribed roles were deeply ingrained in everything the family did. As the oldest, Enrique had suffered through various talks with his parents about what it meant to be a young man, the older brother. What was expected of him, what he would become one day. His own life, having a job and family. More worringly, Enrique suspected that his father was even going to set him down for that Talk very soon.

Ambitions and traditions that were too much for the currently twelve Enrique. He felt that he rarely got as many chances to be a kid as his friends with less austere parents. Enrique was expected to be groomed, polite, to never talk back to his folks and focus on the important things in life. Many of his toys were taken away or passed down to his sister, a sister who could still get away with childish antics. He couldn't have as much fun as his friends with more open minded parents.

Although he dreaded his upcoming maturity, for how his father put it, Enrique was allowed to ask for whatever he wanted for his birthday celebration. A reasonable birthday, rather.

Which Enrique feared he would never be able to convince his padre of having his thirteenth birthday at Gerbert Gerbil & the Cosmic Crew.

Enrique could still vividly remember the first birthday he attended there, his friend's 11th. To Enrique, and all of his friends at the time, Gerbet's was the most fantastic place could be. A restaurant filled with games and space themed decor, complete with the mind blowing mascots that moved about in robotic performances. Enrique remembered having the time of his life there.

And he could also remember his padre's disapproving eye. His father didn't understand the frivolity of a place like Gerbert's. He was very straightforward. Sometimes Enrique thought that padre had not had any childhood to speak of. Enrique's following exposure to Gerbert's was limited since that party, again for the importance of being the oldest child weighing him down. It made the restaurant quite the forbidden fruit in Enrique's upbringing. He felt that if he could have one last hurrah, one time he could be a kid before he was meant to mature quickly, he would be more accepting of his parents' teachings.

How to broach the proposal of his birthday, though, was the real sticking point.
145.title: A Lad's Last Hurrah

choices: Already Mercedes is causing trouble for Enrique.
Enrique is teased for having to chaperone his sister.
Enrique develops a crush towards another person at Gerbert's.
1452.content:
"Padre, about where I would like to go..."

Enrique could already feel his words trail off. His strict father was giving him a severe look over the kitchen table that Saturday morning. Mr. Vega had to work most weekends, although the children could enjoy time off from school. Enrique had hoped that catching his father at the brief morning time would help his approach.

"I would like to go to Gerbert Gerbil's."

His padre frowned into his breakfast. "That is hardly the place for a young man like you to be."

"OOooh, Gerbert Gerbil's!" Enrique's young sister Mercedes hopped in her seat. "Por favor, padre, can I go to Gerbert's too!!"

Enrique winced at Mercedes' interjection. She was about to blow it for him. Mercedes, plump and dimpled 'little' Mercedes received all the attention and freedoms Enrique felt he had been denied. In the Vega family it seemed that the sister did not have to mature as quickly as the brother. She could on spoiling from not only their parents but abuelos and other family relations.

Mr. Vega looked critically between his two children, Enrique feared what his reaction would be. Finally he spoke. "You may take Mercedes to the gerbil place."

Enrique was crestfallen. Of course a 'childish' place like Gerbert's was only appropriate for children like his sister. He hated been shackled to Mercedes as her chaperone.

His father continued. "If you take your responsibility seriously, we may talk about your celebration."

Enrique nodded. Although inwardly he had dark thoughts about his sister ruining his chance to ask his father about the party directly.



"Darse prisa, hermano!" Mercedes had eagerly rushed ahead to the door of Gerbert Gerbil & the Cosmic Crew, pudgy knees kicking up the skirt of her dress.

"Hold on!" Enrique called out, left chaining their bikes to the bike rack outside. He sighed. It was almost worse than not getting his thirteenth birthday as he wanted; a day having to mind Mercedes at Gerbert Gerbil's. He chance for his own party weighed down by having to cater to the whims of his sister. And Mercedes could get quite loud when things weren't going her way.
1452.title: Minding Mercedes

choices: Juanita gets Enrique his birthday party, on one BIG condition.
Enrique has to fill a few favors for his end of the bargain.
Even Juanita can't convince Mr. Vega! Perhaps if Enrique had a secret party?
1453.content:
Enrique felt that, if all he could do was ask his father about having one last birthday at Gerbert's, he would never get his father to say yes. So he needed help from family. Not immediate family, for if pressed their mother would side with their father on most disputes. But there was somebody who could help change his point of view.

So surreptitiously, on the way home from school Enrique made a beeline towards Gerbert Gerbil's as soon as the bell rang. He could squeeze in his appeal before he was expected to walk Mercedes home from her school. It was that sweet-spot of time before Gerbert's got busy with after school kids wanting to grab a snack and hit the arcade.

After entering the front door Enrique found the main office quickly. Much to the surprise of the supervisor inside.

"Enrique? Does your padre know you're here?"

Juanita Suarez was a senior manager at Gerbert Gerbil's, his mother's sister. The two were very different especially in regards to height. Juanita was short. Very short. She was no taller than some of the common child clientele at Gerbert's, although she had the body of a matured adult. Perhaps her perspective helped her with her job, along with her no-nonsense personality when it came to task setting much like her brother in law.

"No, he doesn't know," Enrique admitted, "but I wanted to ask you something."

Juanita crossed her arms over her chest, her sleeves a star spangled periwinkle befitting the manager's uniform. "I'm listening."

"Do you think you could convince padre to let me have my thirteenth birthday here?"

"Mi sobrino," Juanita looked mock aghast, "you know how convinced your padre is about this. He thinks you're too old already to be frequenting here."

"But you don't think so, right auntie?"

"I wouldn't care because you are family, Enrique. But I am not your parent, I don't know how you think I could convince him."

That was just Juanita talking as a responsible adult. Enrique knew he just needed to butter his aunt up to convince her to help him. "Please auntie, I'll never ask you for anything ever again!"

Juanita sighed. "There will be future times you ask favors, Enrique."

"Please, I swear I will never ask anything of you again," Enrique pleaded.

"Alright," Juanita shushed him. "I'm going to be busy with the afternoon here but I'll see what I can do."
1453.title: Auntie Appeal

15.content:
Unlike the other chapters, assumed to follow characters around the everyday workings of a children's restaurant and entertainment venue, the option here is to play around with the setting. The location of Gerbert's is just as much a character as the human (and inhuman) denizens, as much the director of its own growth as any single person.

Stories within this category explore the alternate what-ifs from the establishment of Gerbert's being radically different. Of how the business has succeeded or failed and what reputation has formed in the public consciousness. And more importantly, how the avenues for weight gain change.

Depending on the altered setting some characters may appear again in new roles. Or new characters may be created. Particularly in areas where the franchise is said to gain in popularity there's likely new mascots alongside Gerbert, Hippo Don, Moolia, Fuchsia and Bellixie. Yet the original mascots should not be forgotten about, as the banner of all these ventures is still Cosmic Crew Entertainment.

Shopping Mall

Little has changed for this version of Gerbert's, the restaurant and play layout being nearly exact save for a key difference. Instead of being a standalone establishment, Gerbert's is housed within the local mega-mall. As such the main cast and crew would likely be the same (or different if you prefer) yet the proximity Gerbert's has creates new risks and tension. Without its previous isolation what would the feeding and horror of Gerbert's be like butting against more normal establishments? What conflicts are between the Gerbert's staff and that of the other properties? Then again, there's something to be said for the mall's food court. And anyone in need of an upped wardrobe size need only walk to the closest clothing store.

Party Warehouse

At Cosmic Crew Parties Delivered, why go out to book your child's birthday when the fun can come right to you? The business model has switched from attracting customers to a single location to renting out the animatronics to private affairs. The most advanced versions of the mascot animatronics are stored at this warehouse, capable of full ambulatory support for their entertainment routines. With the 'fun' being delivered right to your home, it leaves the party warehouse as a very utilitarian place. Although the catering floor is more or less normal the problems really begin at the designated animatronic housing and maintenance. Every problem that could be had with the animatronics is had for the repair mechanics and the overstressed transport drivers setting up each party. With this as the most isolated version of Gerbert's in some respects the traumatic issues the company begets are out of the public eye. As such personnel safety (and basic employee comfort) has fallen by the wayside.

Horror Attraction

Get your fright on at Gerbert's Scarefest, an up and coming horror attraction put on by new ownership. Based on the various permutations of the horrific crimes claimed to occur at the original Gerbert Gerbil's, fulfilling childhood memories is abandoned in favor of targeting a mature audience with subverted nostalgia. Whatever happened at Gerbert's was really bad. Although many say that with those uncanny, off-putting jerky animatronics the endeavor was doomed to fail from the outset. The proprietors of the horror attraction have strived for a mix of macabre atmosphere and restaurant authenticity. Just don't expect any competent cooks anytime soon, as what other amenities beyond the haunted walk are still up in the air. As for the main draw itself the utilities and effects are overdone and untested. Will Gerbert's Scarefest turn into the coolest haunt or the lamest tourist trap? Or more horribly, the latest terror.

Television Show

Within the intellectual property of the Gerbert's brand is an animated cartoon following the mascot characters. The next show proves to be more ambitious, bridging animated shorts with live action performers and animatronic puppets, all set on a very far out 'Cosmic Crew Central Station.' Rather, a television studio's creation of a Gerbert's looking establishment set on an orbiting space station (orbiting what planet, again?). For a television show way over budget there's a delicious amount of cheese, be it from the break table or the mediocre performance, scripts and acting. In many ways having a part on Gerbert's is more of a career killer than a career launcher (we mean this in the figurative sense...we think...), thanks to the dubious life lessons the show aims to teach. Inconsistent continuity, unresearched science, unhealthy habits and the most inaccurate view of space? This will likely not be genius programming, rather a collective hissy fit for those having stardom go to their head!

Amusement Park

Instead of failing, Cosmic Crew Entertainment's flagship franchise has been more successful than anyone could have ever expected. The crowning achievement is this small amusement park with planned expansion well underway, Gerbert's Galaxy Spaceport! Food and entertainment has spread out to include unprecedented attractions for the Gerbert's franchise. With this broadening of the brand many new mascots have been created, to say nothing of the many jobs created to cook, clean, repair and secure the facility. With an amusement park the reach of Gerbert's is bigger and better than ever! A credence taken to the heart of management, the bigger the better. Yet given the karmic imbalance due to the franchise park may not be too big to fail. Accidental doom (to say nothing of premeditated doom) can now hit the biggest scale of catastrophe.
15.title: Settings

151.content:
Crosscreek Glen Mall was already a modest success before Gerbert Gerbil & the Cosmic Crew opened there. It was a two and a half story mall with approximately a hundred and forty storefronts, stalls and shops. It was certainly the biggest mall in the region, the kind decked out in plastic tropical plants and a high vaulted glass atrium in the center. Surrounded by parking lots that went on and on and on.

Before Gerbert's the mall already boasted an impressive variety of venues. There was the food court, specialty shops, attractions like a bowling alley and exercise club. There had been three other restaurants connected to the mall, offering causal dining in contrast to the food court's grab and go service. Crosscreek Glen Mall attracted all kinds of shoppers. Families went there for their purchasing needs and perhaps eating out. Teens flocked to the mall in their cliques if they weren't looking for part time jobs. Kids were drawn to the child friendly shops and play area. There was also a dedicated nursery to mind the young, impatient toddlers while their families were working through their shopping list.

Suffice to say, Crosscreek Glen Mall was not prepared for Gerbert Gerbil's.

No other restaurant was as intricate. You had full dining, an outer space theme, in house arcade, animatronic mascots along with myriad infrastructure, office space and utilities for the inner workings of the party center. Gerbert's existed as its own microcosm within the mall's amenities. And they could host birthdays there. Upon their grand opening birthdays had been booked out for eight months solid, with more coming throughout the year. Add to this the Gerbert's gift shop next to the entrance, selling some merchandise and toys while keeping the exclusive stuff as arcade prizes to entice patrons to spend their coin on the games.

As Gerbert's had beat out two other lucrative properties looking to lease the mall space, the restaurant looked poised to singlehandedly take Crosscreek Glen Mall to the next level of retail outlets. Nearly five months of renovations had taken place to overhaul the space for the future Gerbert's layout, making mall visitors curious as to what was going on at the establishment.

People flocked to check out the newest mall property, seeing the shows starring the signature Cosmic Crew: astronaut Gerbert Gerbil, funky-pop musician Hippo Don, desert making Moolia the Cow and vibrant Fuchsia the Flamingo.

Who's to say, maybe the restaurant was going to be a success?
151.title: Shopping Mall

1511.content:
Lainey Burges needed this job.

Heck, any job would do but she had struck out at each other store in the mall. The positions hiring weren't interested in a high school drop out. She was desperate for income.

The eighteen year old fidgeted in the booth where she was told to wait. Lainey had shoulder length auburn hair and a lanky build, although currently she was hunched over, feeling sick to her stomach. What if she struck out at the entire mall? No other places were hiring, she wouldn't be able to make rent. Her only chance now lay in the most expansive restaurant Crosscreek Glen Mall had ever seen.

In all honesty, Gerbert Gerbil and the Cosmic Crew kind of creeped Lainey out. The oversized animal animatronics with their stiff movements and uncanny expressions just didn't sit right with her. She was objectively trying to ignore them, hoping her chances of employment weren't hampered by disliking the mascots.

It didn't help that she hadn't eaten all day. Money was tight and she promised herself she wouldn't splurge on a meal until after she had secured a job. The greasy air filled with the smells of pizzas, fries, and onion rings did little to help Lainey curb her appetite. Her gaze was starting to loose focus as she stared over to another table where a kid was halfway through the pepperoni special.

"Miss Burges?"

"Yes!" Lainey stood quickly, scraping her knee on the underside of the table. She winced in place of a smile.

"I'm Greg Pierce, head of operations and security." A middle aged man shook her hand. "I'm overseeing the hiring today, if you'll just follow me."

Lainey was guided through the twisty corridors of the Gerbert's restaurant at the back of the mall. Seating, arcade, kitchen and all jutted next to each other as Mr. Pierce sidestepped into a cramped office space. He closed the door, making the air hot and stuffy.

"So why would you want to work for Gerbert Gerbil's?" Mr. Pierce asked.

Lainey plastered a smile, going back over what she had rehearsed. "It just looks like a fun place! Being able to make kids and families happy with your service."

And it was really her last choice.

Mr. Pierce sat back in his chair, contemplating Lainey's response. "We'll need to complete some final paperwork but I'd say you're hired, Miss Burges."

As eager for work as she was Lainey was still taken aback. "Really? Just like that?"

"We're looking to fill several positions in staff," Mr. Pierce said. "I tend to vouch for younger staffers, as they can show a lot of promise and can be trained into core members of the team." He had an odd small that Lainey didn't notice, euphoric that she had finally found work.

What a bad time for her stomach to gurgle nosily.

Much to Lainey's embarrassment Mr. Pierce had heard. He chuckled. "How about a slice as we finish up your interview? We like to keep our employees happy, so there's some generous lunch break options when you're on the clock. We're also in negotiations for some benefits with the other storefronts."

The rest of the day was a blur of forms and early training. Much of it Lainey wouldn't recall after the taste of the pizza. She had three slices: cheese, sausage and supreme. More than what she had been able to eat recently. After smelling it all the time she had waited for her interview the taste was heavenly. It left her with a warm, comforting feeling in the bottom of her stomach. It looked like things were about to change for Lainey Burges.
1511.title: Lainey's Interview

choices: Lainey's potbelly becomes more pronounced from further overeating.
Another member of staff notices the changes in Lainey.
While Lainey gets chummy with coworkers, an incident causes issues at the mall.
15111.content:
To say the job at Gerbert's had changed Lainey's life around was an understatement.

Over her first few weeks Lainey had learned the ropes of working at the animatronic filled restaurant. She had worked openings and closings, entering the mall in the off hours either to help begin or shut down the business for the day. She had learned to take orders and deliver food, how to wipe down the seats and arcade cabinets. There was constant activity and the needs to clear up after messy patrons, the kids.

Lainey approached her work with zeal however. Not only was she getting a paycheck she was getting decent meals again. She had been living half-starved since she had dropped out of high school and cut ties with her family. Working at Gerbert's, as noisy, stressful and cramped it could be, had its share of perks.

The staff were encouraged to know the menu to best provide suggestions to customers. Lainey could build up one combo plate once per shift for her break. She still hadn't been able to taste everything yet! From the multitude of pizza varieties, the burgers and sandwiches, chicken and scores of sides available, no two meals were exactly the same.

Add to this the generosity of strangers, as Lainey was still new on staff so she had trouble remembering names. A nice, over plump cook in the kitchen had noticed how starved Lainey had been, so she would slip the teen extra portions on her lunch break tray. The end of shift brought with it a lot of staled out food, still perfectly edible but considered unattractive to customers. It wasn't surprising then that many staffers would take leftovers home, a detail Lainey had picked up from observation.

Getting used to the animatronic movements and performances was still a challenge. Lainey saved her best fake smiles for whenever she had to regard the company mascots with enthusiasm. Getting through those uncomfortable moments gained her the personal reward of milkshake she had hidden in her company thermos.

After two weeks, the lanky teen was starting to get the hang of working at Gerbert's. Despite her apprehensions around the mascots, Lainey was a lot more confident and lively. A slight physical change was present as well. Tucked within her employee uniform was a hint of a potbelly from all her recent snacking.
15111.title: Digging In

choices: Lainey can't remain oblivious forever. She's shocked when someone calls her fat.
She's not the only one with this issue. Who else has been gaining at Gerbert's?
There's no sign of Lainey slowing down, her waistline only increases.
151111.content:
Just as Lainey was getting used to working at Gerbert's in the mall, a new challenge threatened her confidence. It started innocuous at first, so subtle that Lainey didn't realize she was the center of giggles belonging to the children patrons of the animatronic restaurant. Soon it couldn't be ignored, she'd be dropping off a tray for a party of kids and she'd notice their mischievous eyes darting away whenever she would meet their gaze.

Was Lainey at the center at some sort of joke? She tried asking coworkers about what could be so funny but nobody gave her a straight answer, Most of the adult staff were better at hiding their mirth at Lainey's expense.

All Lainey would have to do is look down. Really look down and realize her stomach was no longer as flat as she remembered. Everyone was getting a chuckle over how Lainey's budding potbelly had increased in size, some love handles beginning to crest the waist of her pants. Lainey had never been a girl to gain weight before and she was currently oblivious to the implications of her abuse of the employee lunch program since she started working at Gerbert's. Fat approached the lanky teenager's frame with confusion, only settling around her belly thus far.

Even tied back by her uniform's apron Lainey's new belly jiggled constantly. She wore thin shirts and every shimmy was visible to customers, particularly the kids who would be eye level with her stomach. Lainey must have gained a dozen pounds or so, not used to such greasy and constantly available food before coming to work in the mall. This was the closet the high school dropout would get to the infamous occurrence that happened to college freshmen.

All Lainey knew is that the laughter and snickers seemingly at her expense was beginning to stress her out. Although she kept to her designated hours for lunch, whenever she would circle back to the employees only area on her rounds she would nibble at the food she had set aside for her upcoming lunch. Her burgeoning potbelly didn't want for much, as the frequent nibbles typically led to getting fresh portions come lunch. Thus Lainey was grazing about two meals or so over the entire course of her shift, although she thought she only had the one meal on her break.
151111.title: Non-Freshman Fifteen

Working at the warehouse is quite bleak and daunting.
Internal rumors are starting to circulate about the different departments.
152.content:
The real trick about Cosmic Crew Parties Delivered was that few people knew where it was. Of course it had a billable address for tax records and public notices needed for a company. It was just that nobody ever went there unless they worked there. After all, 'Parties Delivered' was right there in the company title. Of course you never went there, the party came to you.

Each facet of the company had it's own floor of the warehouse. All rentals were carried out by the dedicated phone lines in the administrative office, also handling payroll, marketing, internal affairs and all the other bureaucratic needs a business needs. Next came the catering floor, with a big industrial kitchen and fully stocked pantry and freezers to pump out pizzas, cakes, sides and other treats to feed at party. Inventory had its own floor as well, a warehouse of Cosmic Crew plushies, toys and other presents to wrap up for that special birthday boy or girl. Then you had the maintenance floor for the animatronics. The main cast of Gerbert Gerbil, Hippo Don, Moolia the Cow and Fuchsia the Flamingo had their charging stations with reams of replacement parts. Sure, it took a long while for the animatronics to charge but these were state of the art. They could move and walk on their own without power cords, relying on clunky internal batteries. Sure they were massive but that allowed for multiple kids to crowd in on the photo.

Cosmic Crew Parties Delivered had a motor pool with its own fleet of trucks. One set of trucks was used solely to transport the animatronics. The others were for catering and gifts. Most parties were a two truck delivery. The drivers and handlers would set up the venue, oversee the party, and then bring the animatronics back home to recharge.

Does this sound like a lot? That's because it was. While the warehouse looked normal from the outside, nigh unrecognizable as being the home of Gerbert and friends without the small sign by the front door, the rest of the floors were underground. Few knew how far deep, most sticked to the elevator instead of the stairs. That elevator could take awhile to go from floor to floor.

It was too ambitious to fail. A tad too ambitious. All this warehouse space and they only had one set of the Cosmic Crew animatronics. Sure, there were plenty of spare parts to build more but only the sole set had managed to work. Management was aiming to expand gradually, keep to exclusive high paying customers until they could branch out to multiple markets.

Almost ironically, the party warehouse with a business mission to create joy and wonder for children's birthday's was a joyless place to work. All the magic, as it were, happened at location when the private party tucked into their spread and saw the animatronics roam about to meet the kids. The warehouse was solely a business. No customers came here, few if any decorations lined the halls. For the skeletal staff meant to work in such an oversized facility, some could forget that the Cosmic Crew brand was meant to inspire minds to the far reaches of space. The warehouse was just the opposite, the most mundane industrial bunker you could have on earth, a seemingly normal place save for its fantastic wares.

Working at Cosmic Crew Parties Delivered, whenever you weren't on assignment you felt cut off from the rest of the world.
152.title: Party Warehouse

choices: Follow along some customers as they go through the Scarefest.
A lot of truthers and paranormal investigators are drawn here.
So what is so frightening at Gerbert's Scarefest?
153.content:
Whoever had initially proposed the ideal of this attraction was ludicrous. Seriously, Gerbert Gerbil & the Cosmic Crew? Who actually remembered that franchise? Let alone, for those that did know of it and knew the lore about the tragedies that lead to its downfall, who would want to remember it? Missing children, unsolved crimes, plenty of urban legends surrounded that moniker. That dead bodies were stuffed into suits, the pizzas were made with real human meat, a malevolent computer virus had locked down the whole facility. Dead at night, just when you thought you were alone, you saw the glow of the old restaurant's neon in the distance and heard the alien music.

Poppycock and conspiracies that drove a set of hard core fans to mull over the mysteries that went nowhere, of puzzling reactions to the former Cosmic Crew Entertainment's real agenda. A niche market at best.

And then the rebuttal. It was so obscure, the stories about what really went wrong at Gerbert's so myriad and divorced of the franchise (even morphing into other, similar scary stories) made it perfect for a horror attraction. Animatronics? Scary as hell, just with how off they looked. A restaurant theme? Well, unnerving people with food was easy to do and a Halloween staple. Heck, even if that fright fell through people could still be charged for pizza slices and hot dogs, so that was a plus. A specced themed ex-children's party center? Well, the rest of the ideas for the attraction just about wrote itself.

Thus became Gerbert's Scarefest, meant to launch new ownership of the character copyrights into fright flinging superstardom. That is, if the star up company wasn't way over budget on trying to scrape this haunted experience together.

The other main problem was that the original Gerbert's had been demolished. You didn't find anything associated with it around anymore. Maybe if you were lucky, some novelty cups and a stuffed toy prize left rarely used in the back of a closet. To say nothing of anything that was proven to belong to the restaurant, such as a particular video game cabinet, uniform, or the holy grail of subverted nostalgia itself, a complete animatronic frame.

All this and more plagued Gerbert's Scarefest from the beginning. It takes a consistent level of followthrough, or rather insanity, to see such a project from start to finish. Lucky, bigger things had been done before with even smaller budgets. Some other unassociated unused building was used to house the attraction. A mock layout of the original restaurant was built into a maze. Simple creepy sights and scare zones were eked out with sweat and elbow grease. To complete the tour outside the exit was going to be the concessions, which snared any newcomers towards the ticket both.

Gerbert's Scarefest was a rush build. It turned out most of the props had been collected or salvaged before hand, which made the installation easier. Still, no true building contractor had touched the horror attraction. If the haunted house was meant to scare people working there would be a nightmare.
153.title: Horror Attraction

choices: Look in on some cast dealing with the stress of the show.
Look at an impending disaster about to befall the studio.
Look behind the scenes of some iconic episodes.
154.content:
"Cut! Print! We're watching the dailies in twenty minutes."

Activity was nonstop on the set of Cosmic Crew Central Station, the latest series in the Cosmic Crew Entertainment media library. For fans of the classic cartoons of Gerbert and the gang, along with fans of the iconic restaurant, it was going to be one of the biggest shows ever. The studio had managed to construct a sleek looking space station for the primary set of the show.

The interior was built somewhat like the main dining hall of the Gerbert Gerbil's restaurant, only in a round room with other features of the space station branching off. Everything was decked out in red trim and chrome, both retroactive and futuristic in the design. And like many filmed sets, all cleverly built to provide the illusion of television. The sets were built on raised platforms to allow for the puppet and animatronic controls to be built underneath. Tracks, wires and cables needed for more of the articulated characters were hidden out of sight of the camera shots.

A good looking set for its time. It would help if the shooting schedule wasn't so stressful. Based on early viewership the studio was trying to crank out as many episodes as possible, making the actors and technicians almost work nonstop. To say nothing of the animation department, under even worse deadlines to get the animated sketches finished.

But like they say, a production is only as good as its crew. Although this was their first television show for several in the cast and crew, the main studio operatives were no strangers to the requirements to keep filming going. Makeup, lighting, effects, sound tech, and set design ran smoothly. Owing to the long hours demanded at the studio the break table was lavish. Nearly as expansive as the Gerbert's restaurant menu. While the televised segments had their bit product placement for the franchise food nearly anything could be found for the break table after a few days. A modicum of comforts that kept cast and crew happy.

It seemed like the show could only get bigger and bigger for its new season. Which would hopefully distract everyone from those nasty rumors spreading around the studio. Every production had its own share of problems, no show was ever perfect. Be they factual or not Cosmic Crew Central Station was said to be plagued with many stange occurrences and breakdowns. They said never to work with children or animals in this business; however, that adage should be expanded to never work with animatronics. Even like human actors and operators they could flub up in eerie ways.

But seriously, all those issues the show faces are unfounded. Right? ......right?
154.title: Television Show

choices: See a family with their day of fun at the Galaxy Spaceport!
Learn about what kind of operations keep the park afloat.
Discover what strange new characters have joined the Cosmic Crew.
155.content:
Nobody had expected this level of success back when Gerbert Gerbil & the Cosmic Crew first opened. An animatronic family restaurant with arcade, play area headlined by an astronaut gerbil? From its first implementation it was a novelty. Add some merchandise and a cartoon show featuring the mascot characters and the franchise for Cosmic Crew Entertainment became an unprecedented hit.

If anything, the business was the comeback king in the face of failure. Be it crime, lackluster operations, lack of safety or a stigma of hauntings, the Gerbert's brand found a way to find new venues. And the crowning project of all was the plans for the theme park.

It was a wonder it was never thought of before. An amusement park with food, rides and attractions was just an expsanion to the original concept of family dining & entertainment that made Gerbert's what it was today. Building a park is far more expensive than building a restaurant, even one as complex as Gerbert's with everything that needed to be scaled up for a larger space.

To the anticipation of fans everywhere, Gerbert's Galaxy Spaceport! soon launched in a county not too far from the original restaurant location. With half the park built on a lakeshore boardwalk, it was a modest start in terms of attractions. Several rides, a couple roller coasters, other things to see and do. But the real money maker was the core of corporate's business structure. The food. Knowing the tastes of their customers and the ease of setting up the food stalls first while the rides were still being worked on, no expense was spared on getting the park's dining options ready. There were people that came to the amusement park just for the food alone!

At long last, the fun experiences with Gerbert Gerbil & his Cosmic Crew could reach an untold number of visitors, with guests and tourists increasing by the day. After all the struggles and turmoil for the franchise, hype for the characters had reached their peak. Nothing else could go wrong now.

Except when it does.
155.title: Amusement Park

info.brief_description: The highs and lows of a complex kids pizzeria, of both the weighty and horrific variety.
info.description:
The following is a weight gain and expansion related interactive at the animatronic filled family dining “deathtrap” of Gerbert Gerbil & the Cosmic Crew. It began as a Five Nights at Freddy’s fanfic but shifted into creating original material in that vein. Characterization and world building are encouraged, pertaining to the dark secrets the party center hides.

Before we begin, a few guidelines:

Pre-2000’s aesthetics: Gerbert’s was built (and is generally written) in an ambiguous late 70s to mid 80s to early 90s timeframe. Although the technology present at the establishment will be advanced for its time, on the whole the function and aesthetics are rooted in analog first and early digital second. This means that cell phones are not as widespread, personal computers are quite sizable and the internet is just starting to reach consumers with dial up sluggishness.

Gradual Gain: the weight gain and expansion of the characters may be unusual at times although it should strive for some realism. This means no major gains from a single meal and other blatant displays. However you are free to use time jumps in your options, or delve into the surreal in dreamlike or hallucinogenic sequences.

Write Your Best: there are no precise word count minimums, although you should write more than a paragraph in your entries. I encourage you to write your best. I may pass through chapters to catch typos although I won’t overwrite your additions.

That being said…

Unlike other weight gain interactives this story also delves into horror. Events can be perilous for characters and end messily. However, if the material becomes too graphic or explicit I will tone down or outright delete the chapter. Please mind the overall rating of the piece, 13+, when crafting your addition.

Please see the accompanying document ("Full Mealtimes At Gerbert's Story Notes" ) for character and setting notes.
